page.portfolio.projects.title: Aposcar
page.portfolio.projects.short-description: A website to bet on the Oscar winners
page.portfolio.projects.description: Aposcar is a minimal viable product (MVP) web application designed for cinephiles to engage in predicting Oscar winners for various categories. Users can cast their votes, and the platform provides a real-time leaderboard showcasing predictions. Built with Django in the backend and React in the frontend, Aposcar offers a simple and immersive experience for movie enthusiasts eager to participate in the excitement of the Oscars.

page.portfolio.projects.title: Fila dos Bandecos
page.portfolio.projects.short-description: A website to check and update queue lengths at university restaurants
page.portfolio.projects.description:
With my univerity returning to in-person activities post-covid, but with university restaurants operating at 50% of their capacity, we were been facing huge queues. Based on the initiative of Skyrats - intelligent MAVs team to organize message groups so that students could be informed about the situation of each restaurant, I decided to start a project that could help the student community. 
With less than a week of development, using technologies such as Django, React, NextJS and Postgres, I set up a website where students can check and update the status of each of the queues!

page.portfolio.projects.title: MTG Tracker
page.portfolio.projects.short-description: A mobile app to track your Magic: The Gathering winrate
page.portfolio.projects.description: MTGTracker is a mobile application designed for competitive Magic: The Gathering (MTG) players to keep track of their matches, maintain a detailed history, and analyze performance statistics. The app aims to provide valuable insights, such as win rates, mulligan frequencies, and information on decks that pose challenges, empowering players to make informed decisions and improve their skills.

page.portfolio.projects.title: Project Nekton
page.portfolio.projects.short-description: A vertical-scrolling mobile gaming about a submarine exploring the ocean depths
page.portfolio.projects.description:
Project Nekton was the codename for a series of  operations that ended with the United States Navy entering the Challenger Deep, the deepest surveyed point in the world's oceans. 
This game was made in one week as a self challenge. It's a vertical scrolling mobile game where you're a submarine trying to get to the bottom of the ocean while getting oxygen supplies and avoiding bumping into fish.

page.portfolio.projects.title: Goblins & Capivaras
page.portfolio.projects.short-description: A proof of concept of a 2D survival game.
page.portfolio.projects.description: A whimsical survival game where you play as a resourceful adventurer collecting materials during the day and fending off goblin attacks at night. Your goal is to expand your toolset by gathering 'dablooms' to increase your chances of survival. But don't forget about the most important member of your team - the trusty capybara! When you need to stock up on supplies, be sure to visit the quirky shopkeeper - a feline in a top hat. Can you make it through the nights and become the ultimate survivalist? - Chat GPT
